An application, by changing - * the socket factory that creates the socket implementation, - * can configure itself to create sockets appropriate to the local - * firewall. + * {@code SocketImpl} class. @@ -99,1 +94,0 @@ - * @see java.net.Socket#setSocketImplFactory(java.net.SocketImplFactory) @@ -211,0 +205,1 @@ + @SuppressWarnings("deprecation") @@ -285,1 +280,0 @@ - * @see java.net.Socket#setSocketImplFactory(java.net.SocketImplFactory) @@ -287,1 +281,0 @@ - * @see java.net.SocketImplFactory#createSocketImpl() @@ -321,1 +314,0 @@ - * @see java.net.Socket#setSocketImplFactory(java.net.SocketImplFactory) @@ -323,1 +315,0 @@ - * @see java.net.SocketImplFactory#createSocketImpl() @@ -451,1 +442,0 @@ - * @see java.net.Socket#setSocketImplFactory(java.net.SocketImplFactory) @@ -453,1 +443,0 @@ - * @see java.net.SocketImplFactory#createSocketImpl() @@ -495,1 +484,0 @@ - * @see java.net.Socket#setSocketImplFactory(java.net.SocketImplFactory) @@ -497,1 +485,0 @@ - * @see java.net.SocketImplFactory#createSocketImpl() @@ -557,0 +544,1 @@ + @SuppressWarnings("deprecation") @@ -1735,0 +1723,1 @@ + @Deprecated(since = "17") @@ -1737,0 +1726,1 @@ + @Deprecated(since = "17") @@ -1764,0 +1754,9 @@ + * @deprecated Use {@link SocketChannel}, or subclass {@code Socket} + * directly. + *
This method provided a way in early JDK releases to replace the + * system wide implementation of {@code Socket}. It has been mostly + * obsolete since Java 1.4. If required, a {@code Socket} can be + * created to use a custom implementation by extending {@code Socket} + * and using the {@linkplain #Socket(SocketImpl) protected + * constructor} that takes an {@linkplain SocketImpl implementation} + * as a parameter. @@ -1765,0 +1764,1 @@ + @Deprecated(since = "17")
